bib_record.title: Elastic scattering of 33 MeV tritons and isospin dependence of mass-3 optical potential.

free_txt: Comparison with optical model prediction.
Ten detector telescopes were used
which consisted of ~100-150 um dE surface barrier
silicon detectors and 5 mm thick lithium drifted
silicon E detectors. The telescopes were mounted on
two movable and remotely controlled arms, which were
on either side of the beam and could be set to within
1 min of arc. The solid angles of the detectors were
determined by the defining apertures (6 mm high and
3 mm wide), placed 300 mm from the target.
Error in the solid angles
Absolute cross section error
Data for Ca-48 are given.
The thicknesses of most targets were measured by
elastic scattering of 24 MeV alpha particles from the
Radial Ridge cyclotron of the University of Birmingham.
The energy resolution was mainly determined by the
target thicknesses and varied from ~50 keV to ~100 keV
for the elastic peak.
The 12C target was 1.35+-0.02 mg/cm2 in thickness.The
target thickness has been obtained by multiple
measurements of the area and weight of the foil.
Fig.2 from Nucl.Phys.,A475(1987)422
Cross sections for 16O were deduced from melinex
(10C8H4O) and oxidized 48Ca targets with corrections
for 12C and 48Ca respectively.
The error bars displayed contain
statistical errors and those arising from the
extraction of contaminants only.
In the case of 16O, the target monitors have been used
to monitor the oxygen build-up in the 48Ca target,which
was found to be negligible.
The 16O target was 0.069+-0.003 mg/cm2 in thickness.
Fig.2 from Nucl.Phys.,A475(1987)422
The error bars displayed contain
statistical errors and those arising from the
extraction of contaminants only.
The 19F target was 0.211+-0.002 mg/cm2 in thickness.
The 19F and 40Ca data were obtained from a target of
Ca2F. The forward angle cross sections for 19F in the
Ca2F target have been determined by eliminating 40Ca
cross sections obtained from the oxygen-free Ca target
of 1.305+-0.037 mg/cm2 thickness.
Fig.2 from Nucl.Phys.,A475(1987)422
